snippet: Using $50 million from the Einhorn Family Charitable Trust, the college will require all students to take at least one course with a community component during their undergraduate careers.
abstract: Cornell University plans to transform its curriculum to make real-world experiences a defining aspect of the undergraduate experience; backed by $50 million from the Einhorn Family Charitable Trust, which university officials intend to augment with $100 million from other philanthropies, the program will be called Engaged Cornell; ultimate goal is to have all graduating students take at least one course with a community-engaged component.
lead_paragraph: Using $50 million from the Einhorn Family Charitable Trust, the college will require all students to take at least one course with a community component during their undergraduate careers.

headline.main: Cornell Plans to Expand Off-Campus Engagement
